    <!-- Intro -->
    <section class="content-section" style="background:#edeeef; padding-top: 4rem; padding-bottom: 6rem">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-sm-12 col-lg-4">
            <div class="team-member" style="margin-bottom:24px">
              <img src="/img/ted_pic.jpg" style="border:8px solid white; width:350px!important; height:100%" class="img-responsive img-circle" alt="Eric Wadkins">
              <div id="social1" class="mt-4">

          <div class="col-sm-12 col-lg-8" id="intro-section" style="margin-bottom: 1rem; margin-top:1rem">
            <h4>Eric Wadkins</h4>
            <p class="lead"><b>MIT '18, M.Eng. Student, Software Engineer, and AI/ML Researcher</b></p>
            <p class="lead" style="font-size: 14pt">I'm a graduate of MIT's Class of 2018 and my passion is Computer Science.
            <br/>My interests include software design and development, artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing.</p>
            <p class="lead" style="font-size: 14pt">I'm currently a graduate student working towards my Master of Engineering (M.Eng.) degree in Computer Science/Artificial Intelligence.</p>
            <p class="lead" style="*font-size: 15pt; margin-bottom:0px"><b>Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)</b></p>
            <ul style="padding-left:30px">
              <li class="lead" style="font-size: 14pt"><b>Master of Engineering in Computer Science/Artificial Intelligence</b></li>
              <li class="lead" style="font-size: 14pt"><b>Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Engineering</b></li>
              <li class="lead" style="font-size: 14pt">Certificate of Advanced Undergraduate Research in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning</li>
            </ul>
              <!--<br/>A general design goal of mine is to automate a process with as little user input as possible.</p>-->
            <div id="social2" class="mt-4">

    <!-- Skills -->
    <section class="content-section bg-primary text-white text-center" id="skills">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="content-section-heading">
          <!--<h3 class="text-secondary mb-0">Skills</h3>-->
          <h2 class="mb-2">Skills</h2>
        </div>
        <div class="container text-center mb-5">
          <p class="lead">Below are some of my skills, and I'm always looking to learn more.</p>
          <p class="lead">(Somewhat outdated, will update soon. Grad student life is very busy!)</p>
        </div>
        <!--<div class="container text-center mt-5">
          <h5>Summary</h5>
          <p class="lead mb-0"><b>Programming/Languages:</b> Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, R, MATLAB, Arduino, Android, GLSL, XML, LaTeX</p>
          <p class="lead" style="padding-bottom:3rem"><b>Libraries/Other:</b> OpenCV, OpenGL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, MongoDB, ANTLR, UNIX, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn,
jQuery, Durandal, Bootstrap, Express, Linux, Git</p>
        </div>-->
        <div class="row" style="margin-bottom: 48px">
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa fa-dot-circle-o fa-2x" style="padding-top:19px;"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>Computer Vision, OpenCV/OpenGL</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">I have significant research experience in the field of computer vision, including <a href="/doc/Computer_Vision_Tools_NV_Centers.pdf" target="blank">Computer Vision Tools for Locating Nitrogren-Vacancy Centers</a>. I've also created dozens of programs using libraries such as OpenCV and OpenGL – these include my <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal8">object tracker</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal4">collage generator</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal5">game engine</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal6">ray casting simulation</a>, and many more.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa fa-share-alt fa-2x" style="padding-top:19px; padding-right:5px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence</b>
            </h4>
              <p class="text-faded mb-0">I've worked on many projects involving machine learning, and am currently a machine learning research assistant with the <a href="https://media.mit.edu/people/ewadkins/" target="blank">MIT Media Lab</a>. Previous research includes <a href="/doc/Smart_Microscopy.pdf" target="blank">Self-Driving Microscopy: Bayesian Inference for
Localization and Autonomous Navigation</a> and the model in <a href="/doc/Utility_Programs_NV_Centers.pdf" target="blank">Utility Programs for Nitrogen-Vacancy Center Identiﬁcation and Initialization Analysis</a>. Relevant personal projects include my <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal1">neural model library</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal2">NN trainer library</a>, and <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal3">NN experiments</a>. I have experience using Tensorflow, PyTorch, and Keras.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa icon-java-bold fa-2x" style="padding-top:20px; padding-left:25px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>Java</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">I have over <b>6 years</b> of software development experience in Java, creating games, plugins, and various other applications, including a <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal10">client request library</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal7">content-aware image resizer</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal9">audio analyzer</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal11">compiler/transpiler</a>, an early version of my <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal5">OpenGL game engine</a> which I later ported to C++, and many more.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa icon-python fa-2x" style="padding-top:24px; padding-left:12px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>Python</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">Over the past <b>3 years</b>, I've had extensive experience with Python in the course of my research, classwork, and personal projects. Some of my personal projects in Python include my <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal12">Monte Carlo Localization library</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal13">smartwatch-controlled presentation tool</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal14">financial graph tool</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal1">neural model library</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal2">NN trainer library</a>, and many more.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa fa-code fa-2x" style="padding-top:16px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>JavaScript, HTML, CSS</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">With a combined <b>7 years</b> of experience from personal projects and work at <a href="http://diameterhealth.com/" target="blank">Diameter Health</a>, I often develop full-stack applications, consisting of HTML/JavaScript/CSS, various web libraries, and a Node.js/MongoDB backend.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa icon-cplusplus fa-2x" style="padding-top:26px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>C++</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">I have over <b>4 years</b> of experience programming in C++. My C++ projects include a <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal5">custom game engine</a> using the OpenGL graphics library, and many other projects relating to machine learning and computer vision using the OpenCV computer vision library, such as my <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal4">collage generator</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal6">ray casting simulation</a>, <a data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal8">object tracker</a>.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5 mb-lg-0">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa icon-nodejs fa-2x" style="padding-top:24px; padding-left:16px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>Node.js</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">I have extensive experience in Node.js and many of its modules, including Express, Request, Grunt, Mocha, Cheerio, Bcrypt, and Oauth2-server, and have created many of my own, including <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/cda-schematron" target="blank">cda-schematron</a>.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-5 mb-lg-0">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa fa-laptop fa-2x" style="padding-top:18px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>jQuery, Durandal, Bootstrap</b>
            </h4>
            <p class="text-faded mb-0">I have significant experience using web libraries such as Durandal, jQuery, and Bootstrap to create web applications for many of my professional and personal projects.</p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4 col-md-6 mb-0">
            <span class="service-icon rounded-circle mx-auto mb-3 text-secondary">
              <i class="fa icon-mongodb fa-2x" style="padding-top:18px"></i>
            </span>
            <h4>
              <b>MongoDB</b>
            </h4>
              <p class="text-faded mb-0">With many years of experience using MongoDB for backends, many of my projects utilize Node's MongoDB driver. Working for <a href="http://diameterhealth.com/" target="blank">Diameter Health</a>, I was responsible for using MongoDB databases efficiently and creating services that allowed for easy interaction between web apps and databases.</p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>

    <!-- Portfolio -->
    <section class="content-section" id="projects">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="content-section-heading text-center">
          <h3 class="text-secondary mb-0">Portfolio</h3>
          <h2 class="mb-2">Personal Projects</h2>
        </div>
        <div class="container text-center mb-5">
          <p class="lead">Here you can see some of the projects I've done on my own time.</p>
          <p class="lead">(Somewhat outdated, will update soon. Grad student life is very busy!)</p>
        </div>
        <div class="row no-gutters">
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal1">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>Neural Model Library</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">Simple creation of feed forward and recurrent neural models in TensorFlow.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/neural_model.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal2">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>NN Trainer Library</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">A library for automatic supervised training of neural models.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/nn_trainer.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal3">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>NN Experiments</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">A collection of various neural network models in TensorFlow.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/nn_experiments.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal4">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>Collage Generator</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">Intelligently draws a message with images.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/collage_small.jpg" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal5">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>OpenGL Game Engine</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">A custom game engine including dynamic lighting, terrain, and static and dynamic objects.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" height="250" src="/img/gameengine_small.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal6">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>Ray Casting Simulation</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">A simulation using AI techniques such as ray casting, spatial mapping, Bayesian filtering, pathfinding, etc.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/raycast_small_gray.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal7">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>Seam Carver</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">An application for content-aware image resizing.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/seamcarver_small.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal8">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">
                  <h4>Object Tracker</h4>
                  <p class="mb-0">An object recognition and tracking tool.</p>
                </span>
              </span>
              <img class="img-fluid portfolio-img" src="/img/objecttracker-small.png" alt="">
            </a>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-4">
            <a class="portfolio-item" data-toggle="modal" href="#portfolioModal9">
              <span class="caption">
                <span class="caption-content">

    <!-- Papers -->
    <section class="content-section bg-primary text-white" id="papers">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-lg-12 text-center">
            <h2 class="section-heading">Papers</h2>
          </div>
        </div>
        <br>
        <div class="row text-center">
          <div class="col-lg-12" style="margin-bottom:12px">
            <h4 class="mb-0">Master's thesis:</h4>
            <a href="/doc/MEng_Thesis_FINAL.pdf" class="lead" target="blank">
                <h5 class="mb-0">A Continuous Silent Speech Recognition System for AlterEgo, a Silent Speech Interface</h5></a>
            <p class="lead" style="line-height:26px">Eric Wadkins. 2019<br><a href="/doc/MEng_Thesis_FINAL.pdf" download="MEng_Thesis_FINAL.pdf">Download <i class="fa fa-download"></i></a></p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-12" style="margin-bottom:12px">
            <a href="/doc/Smart_Microscopy.pdf" class="lead" target="blank">
              <h5 class="mb-0">Self-Driving Microscopy: Bayesian Inference for Localization and Autonomous Navigation</h5></a>
            <p class="lead" style="line-height:26px">Eric Wadkins, Michael Walsh, Dirk Englund. 2018<br><a href="https://www.academia.edu/36778976/Self-Driving_Microscopy_Bayesian_Inference_for_Localization_and_Autonomous_Navigation" target="blank">Academia.edu</a> | <a href="/doc/Smart_Microscopy.pdf" download="Smart_Microscopy.pdf">Download <i class="fa fa-download"></i></a></p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-12" style="margin-bottom:12px">
            <a href="/doc/Computer_Vision_Tools_NV_Centers.pdf" class="lead" target="blank">
              <h5 class="mb-0">Computer Vision Tools for Locating Nitrogen-Vacancy Centers</h5></a>
            <p class="lead" style="line-height:26px">Eric Wadkins, Michael Walsh, Dirk Englund. 2017<br><a href="https://www.academia.edu/33213392/Computer_Vision_Tools_for_Locating_Nitrogen-Vacancy_Centers" target="blank">Academia.edu</a> | <a href="/doc/Computer_Vision_Tools_NV_Centers.pdf" download="Computer_Vision_Tools_NV_Centers.pdf">Download <i class="fa fa-download"></i></a></p>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-12">
            <a href="/doc/Utility_Programs_NV_Centers.pdf" class="lead" target="blank">
              <h5 class="mb-0">Utility Programs for Nitrogen-Vacancy Center
Identification and Initialization Analysis</h5></a> (contributor, &sect;2)
            <p class="lead" style="line-height:26px">Aaron Vontell, Michael Walsh, Eric Wadkins, Dirk Englund. 2017<br><a href="https://www.academia.edu/31449928/Winter_2017_Project_Summary_-_Utility_programs_for_nitrogen-vacancy_center_identification_and_initialization_analysis" target="blank">Academia.edu</a> | <a href="/doc/Utility_Programs_NV_Centers.pdf" download="Utility_Programs_NV_Centers.pdf">Download <i class="fa fa-download"></i></a></p>
            </span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
    
    <!-- Timeline Section -->
    <section class="content-section" id="timeline">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-lg-12 text-center">
            <h2 class="section-heading mb-2">Timeline</h2>
            <!--<p class="lead mb-5">A little bit about me...</p>-->
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="container text-center mb-5">
          <p class="lead">A short summary of my work experience..</p>
        </div>
        <div class="row">
          <div class="col-lg-12">
            <ul class="timeline">
              <li class="timeline-inverted" style="margin-bottom:32px">
                <a href="https://google.com/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/google_square.png" alt="Google">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2019 - Present</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://media.mit.edu/people/ewadkins/" target="blank">Google</a>,<br>Mountain View, CA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">I currently work as a Software Engineer at Google headquarters in Mountain View, California.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li>
                <a href="https://media.mit.edu/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/media_lab_square.png" alt="MIT Media Lab">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2018 - Present</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://media.mit.edu/people/ewadkins/" target="blank">MIT Media Lab</a>, Cambridge, MA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead"><!--For the duration of my graduate degree program, I will be working with the Fluid Interfaces Group in the MIT Media Lab. -->My research on the <b><a href="https://www.media.mit.edu/projects/alterego/overview/" target="blank">AlterEgo project</a></b>, which I demoed at TED 2019, focuses on developing neural network models for a wearable system that allows humans to converse silently, via electrical signals sent by the brain during internal articulation, with machines, AI assistants, and other people. <a href="https://media.mit.edu/people/ewadkins" target="blank"><b>media.mit.edu/people/ewadkins</b></a></p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li class="timeline-inverted">
                <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/nasa_square4.png" alt="NASA">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>Winter 2018</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/" target="blank">NASA</a>, Goddard Space Flight Center, MD</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">For Winter 2018, I was a machine learning intern at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, where I used machine learning to relate satellite measurements to applications of aerosol science. My project focused on using data from the MODIS Terra and Aqua satellites and GEOS-5 forecasting model to create a neural network model for the prediction of cloud effective radius.<!--The Global Modeling and Assimilation Office at NASA uses these measurements in global climate models to answer some of the fundamental questions of climate science.--></p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li>
                <a href="https://google.com/about" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/google_square.png" alt="Google">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>Summer 2017</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://google.com/about/" target="blank">Google</a>, Los Angeles, CA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">In Summer 2017, I interned with Google as a Software Engineering Intern in their Venice, Los Angeles office. As a part of the YouTube team, my work included performance enchancements to some of YouTube's internal infrastructure.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li class="timeline-inverted">
                <a href="http://www.rle.mit.edu/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/rle_square.png" alt="Research Laboratory of Electronics (RLE)">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2017 - 2018</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="http://www.rle.mit.edu/" target="blank">Research Laboratory of Electronics</a>,<br>Cambridge, MA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                  <p class="lead">As a MITRE Undergraduate Research and Innovation Scholar in the Quantum Photonics Laboratory, my work included developing machine learning and computer vision-enabled systems to automate laboratory processes, such as the detection of nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond. Most recently, I led a year-long project into the creation of a smart microscopy system to enable autonomous laboratory experiments.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li>
                <a href="https://www.csail.mit.edu/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/csail_square.png" alt="Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL)">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2016</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://www.csail.mit.edu/" target="blank">Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory</a>,<br>Cambridge, MA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">As an undergraduate researcher, I worked with CSAIL's InfoLab Group to advance their goal of developing intelligent interactive software systems that help people access information and solve problems on human terms. My work there was primarily focused on a video action recognition system.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li class="timeline-inverted">
                <a href="https://www.diameterhealth.com/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/diameterhealth_square2.png" alt="Software Engineer Intern at Diameter Health">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2015 - 2017</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading">
                      <a href="https://www.diameterhealth.com/" target="blank">Diameter Health</a>,<br> Newton, MA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">Starting with a Summer 2015 software engineering internship and advancing into a part-time position throughout the year and up to February 2017, my work at Diameter Health includes designing and developing automated predictive tools and full-stack applications that serve the healthcare industry through their use of clinical intelligence.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <li>
                <a href="http://www.mit.edu/" target="blank">
                  <div class="timeline-image">
                    <img class="img-circle img-responsive" src="/img/mit_logo_square.jpg" alt="Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)">
                  </div>
                </a>
                <div class="timeline-panel">
                  <div class="timeline-heading">
                    <h5>2014 - Present</h5>
                    <h4 class="subheading"><a href="http://www.mit.edu/" target="blank">Massachusetts Institute of Technology</a>,<br>Cambridge, MA</h4>
                  </div>
                  <div class="timeline-body">
                    <p class="lead">As a graduate of the Class of 2018 and a M.Eng. candidate in Computer Science/Artificial Intelligence, I continue to take advantage of many of the interesting learning opportunities that MIT has to offer. I am particularly interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning, and have spent much of my time here focusing on these fields.</p>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </li>
              <!--<li class="timeline-inverted">

    <section class="content-section text-white" id="contact" style="padding-top: 6rem; padding-bottom: 6rem">

    <footer class="footer" style="padding-top: 4rem; padding-bottom: 2rem">
        <div class="container">

    <!-- Portfolio Modals -->

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal1" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Neural Model Library</h2>
                  <p class="lead">Simple creation of feed forward and recurrent neural models in Tensorflow.</p>
                  <p class="lead">This library enables incredibly simple creation of feed forward and recurrent neural models in TensorFlow. Simply specify the input shape, output shape, and a list of components (or layers) to make up the network. The library then figures out the dimensions of each component, initializes each component, and builds the model automatically. Most importantly, the model is able to infer the sizes of intermediate layers (including recurrent inputs) automatically, requiring you to only specify the essentials. This enables you to make quick changes to your entire model in just a few lines.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Several of my friends have commented that, in working on this project, I've essentially just re-created Keras in Tensorflow. In retrospect, it is quite similar to Keras's Sequential model framework, with the addition of being capable of recurrent connections throughout the sequential model. Nonetheless, it was a good learning experience.</p>
                  <p class="lead">More detailed project description coming soon!<br> In the meantime, check out some of my other projects.</p>
                  <!--<img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/mit_seal_square.jpg" alt="">
                  <p class="lead">Use this area to describe your project. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Est blanditiis dolorem culpa incidunt minus dignissimos deserunt repellat aperiam quasi sunt officia expedita beatae cupiditate, maiores repudiandae, nostrum, reiciendis facere nemo!</p>-->
                  <!--<div class="row mb-5">
                      <div class="col-lg-12 col-xl-6" style="padding-top: 6px">
                        <iframe src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=NeuralModel" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe>
                      </div>
                      <div class="col-lg-12 col-xl-6" style="margin-top: auto; margin-bottom: auto">
                        <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins" class="btn btn-xl btn-primary" target="blank">View on GitHub &nbsp;<i class="fa fa-github"></i></a>
                      </div>
                  </div>-->
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/NeuralModel" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/NeuralModel</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=NeuralModel" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal2" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>NN Trainer Library</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A library for automatic supervised training of neural models.</p>
                  <!--<img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/mit_seal_square.jpg" alt="">
                  <p class="lead">Use this area to describe your project. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Est blanditiis dolorem culpa incidunt minus dignissimos deserunt repellat aperiam quasi sunt officia expedita beatae cupiditate, maiores repudiandae, nostrum, reiciendis facere nemo!</p>-->
                  <p class="lead">This library provides methods for training supervised neural network models without the need to implement all the necessary steps (eg. input handling, reformatting, batching, evaluation, feedback, etc.). It also allows for a large amount of customization in the training and evaluation process, while also making assumptions where possible, in order to minimize required user input.</p>
                  <p class="lead">More detailed project description coming soon!<br> In the meantime, check out some of my other projects.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/NNTrainer" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/NNTrainer</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=NNTrainer" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>NN Experiments</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A collection of various neural network models in TensorFlow.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/nn_test.png" alt="Multiclass classifier">
                  <p class="lead">This project consists of a collection of neural network models that I have trained on various datasets (eg. MNIST for digit classification with a CNN). Above, you'll see a simple example of a model that has learned to classify points of each of the four labels (i.e. colors) it's been given.</p>
                  <p class="lead">I started work on this collection of models as a means of learning applied machine learning.</p>
                  <p class="lead">More detailed project description coming soon!<br> In the meantime, check out some of my other projects.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/NeuralNets" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/NeuralNets</a>

              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Collage Generator</h2>
                  <p class="lead">Intelligently draws a message with images.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/collage_big.jpg" alt="Intelligently draws messages with images">
                  <p class="lead">Collage Generator uses machine learning techniques, such as K-Means Clustering, to determine which images should be used to draw the message and which to use as the background.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Given a single set of images (.zip file) and a message to display, my Collage Generator returns a high resolution collage with the message drawn out using the images. It works by determining a subset of images that are the most distinct and drawing the message with those and the background with the others.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/CollageGenerator" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/CollageGenerator</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=CollageGenerator" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal5" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">

              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>OpenGL Game Engine</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A custom game engine including dynamic lighting, terrain, and static and dynamic objects.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/gameengine_big.png" alt="Custom OpenGL game engine">
                  <p class="lead">A custom game engine created from scratch in C++ using OpenGL.</p>
                  <p class="lead">This includes GLSL shader support for dynamic lighting (ambient, diffuse, and specular) and multiple light sources, algorithms to generate multiple different types of terrain (the images above show fractal-generated mountains and hills, respectively), and an intuitive object rendering system that handles both static and dynamic objects.</p>
                  <p class="lead">A previous version of this game engine created in Java using <a href="https://www.lwjgl.org/" target="blank">LWJGL</a> and the <a href="http://jbullet.advel.cz/" target="blank">JBullet Physics Library</a> also includes a customizable object UI and real-time physics that can be used to simulate complicated collisions.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/OpenGLGameEngine" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/OpenGLGameEngine</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=OpenGLGameEngine" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal6" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">

          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Ray Casting Simulation</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A simulation using AI techniques such as ray casting, spatial mapping, Bayesian filtering, pathfinding, etc.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/raycast_big.png" alt="AI simulation using Ray Casting">
                  <p class="lead">An AI which simulates a robot that uses AI techniques to perform tasks such as estimating its location on a map and navigating towards a goal through an unknown maze in real time.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Given an image, the simulation creates a map and uses AI techniques such as ray casting, spatial mapping, Bayesian filtering, and pathfinding to perform tasks such as navigating from a start to a goal given <strong>no knowledge</strong> of the layout the map (as shown in the image above), or determine its location within the map based on the features of the map it has encountered so far.</p>
                  <video id="raycastVideo" width="450" height="450" controls autoplay>
                    <source src="/vid/raycast_video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
                      Your browser does not support the video tag.
                  </video>
                  <script>
                      document.getElementById('raycastVideo').addEventListener('ended', function(e) {
                          setTimeout(function(){
                              document.getElementById('raycastVideo').play();
                          }, 2000);
                      }, false);
                  </script>
                  <p class="lead">The above video shows the AI navigate through the maze from start to goal without any prior knowledge of the map. This is done solely by collecting data from its sensors (the rays are shown in red) which report distances to obstacles, and then using techniques such as spatial mapping and pathfinding (modified <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm" target="blank">A* algorithm</a>).</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/RayCastingSimulation" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/RayCastingSimulation</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=RayCastingSimulation" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal7" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Seam Carver</h2>
                  <p class="lead">An application for content-aware image resizing.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/seamcarver_big.png" alt="Content-aware image resizing">
                  <p class="lead">Using a technique called <a href="http://graphics.cs.cmu.edu/courses/15-463/2007_fall/hw/proj2/imret.pdf" target="blank">seam-carving</a>, this application allows you to take an image and resize it <i>without noticeably effecting the content</i>.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Stretching, shrinking or cropping makes it obvious that an image has been modified, but seam-carving works by removing or adding pixels in the least noticeable locations in order to reduce or enlarge the size of the image. This application provides a UI for my implementation of the seam-carving algorithm. Above is an example of reducing the size of an image using content-aware resizing (the removed pixels are in red).</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/SeamCarver" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/SeamCarver</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=SeamCarver" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal8" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Object Tracker</h2>
                  <p class="lead">An object recognition and tracking tool.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/objecttracker-big.png" alt="Color-Based Object Detection and Tracking">
                  <p class="lead">An object recognition tool using OpenCV which uses color-based detection techniques, such as thresholding and the Hough Circle Transform to detect, learn, and then track different objects.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Using video from your webcam, Object Tracker will detect circular objects which you can then choose to track. After choosing an object, it will then determine the optimal HSV range for thresholding and then track the object based on that range.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/ObjectTracker" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/ObjectTracker</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=ObjectTracker" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal9" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Audio Analyzer</h2>
                  <p class="lead">An audio analyzer and controller for an Arduino-driven LED strip.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" src="/img/audioanalyzer_big.png" alt="Audio analyzer">
                  <p class="lead">This application takes audio input from the microphone or speaker output, processes it, and then calculates certain audio metrics such as intensity gain, bass gain, average intensity, peak frequency, and estimated pitch. Coupled with the audio analyzer is an Arduino LED-controller, which I send serialized data about the changes in audio metrics in order to control a WS2812B LED-strip.</p>
                  <p class="lead">The audio analyzer is able to extract useful information from audio in real-time. When processing the data, it takes into account the non-linearities of the human ear and modifies the data accordingly, in order to extract the most noticeable audio features. Then, it determines what information is required by the LED-controller and uses bit-packing to serialize and send the data as quickly as possible to give the smallest possible response time. Currently, the estimated pitch is mapped to a point on the color spectrum and used to control the hue of the lights, and the bass gain is used to control the brightness of the lights.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Below is an example of the Audio Analyzer listening to the song <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k1gsZ-OsGpI" target="blank">Hymn For The Weekend (Seeb remix) - Coldplay</a>.</p>
                  <video controls="controls" width="915" height="330" name="Audio Analyzer" src="/vid/audioanalyzer.mp4"></video>
                  <p class="lead">Audio Analyzer listening to <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k1gsZ-OsGpI" target="blank">Hymn For The Weekend (Seeb remix) - Coldplay</a></p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/AudioAnalyzer" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/AudioAnalyzer</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=AudioAnalyzer" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal10" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">

          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Request</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A library used for sending HTTP/HTTPS requests with simple data management functions.</p>
                  <p class="lead">A simple library used for sending HTTP and HTTPS requests, with many data management functions designed to make sending requests and parsing the response as easy as possible.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Clients can easily add or modify query parameters, form data, URL-encoded form data, raw data, JSON data, and binary data via a Request object, and then easily read the response from a Response object, which includes automatic parsing into JSON and HTML data structures.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/Request" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/Request</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=Request" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal11" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Compiler/Transpiler</h2>
                  <p class="lead">Parses and compiles a custom programming language into C++.</p>
                  <p class="lead">I've created my own C-based scripting language. While it strongly resembles other languages, it has features that others alone do not have. It includes Java's static type checking, C++'s primitive types, Python's binary operations and nested functions, and JavaScript's expression evaluation and objects.</p>
                  <p class="lead">It is designed to overcome some of the more annoying aspects of C++, such as its inability to be used as a scripting language and resolve functions defined later in the file or nested within other functions. Simultaneously, it retains many of the great features of C++ as well as features from other languages like Python and JavaScript, all while keeping the speed C++ is known for. This is possible because the compiler uses <a href="http://www.antlr.org/" target="blank">ANTLR</a> and a <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/Compiler/blob/master/src/com/ericwadkins/parser/Compiler.g4" target="blank">context-free grammar</a> to parse the code and then transpile it directly into C++.</p>
                  <p class="lead">I'm still working on this project and looking to add more features. Below is a brief example of a the language implementation which demonstrates some of the features of the language so far, followed by the abstract syntax tree generated by the parser.</p>
                  <pre style="text-align:left"><code>
print(test(0));                           // Use as scripting language

unsigned short test(int n) {              // unsigned short return type
    long double x = 2;
    if (n) {                              // if n != 0
        return (unsigned short) x ** n;   // x to the power of n
    }
    return tryAgain();

    unsigned short tryAgain() {           // Nested function
        return test(n + 1);
    }
}
                  </code></pre>
                  <img class="img-responsive img-centered" src="/img/compiler_big3.png" alt="Parser and compiler for CBScript">
                  <p class="lead">Below are two more examples: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_search_algorithm" target="blank">Binary search</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ackermann_function" target="blank">Ackermann function</a>.</p>
                  <pre style="text-align:left"><code>
// Binary Search
int binarySearch(int[] arr, int value, int left, int right) {
    while (left <= right) {
        int middle = (left + right) / 2;
        if (arr[middle] == value)
            return middle;
        else if (arr[middle] > value)
            right = middle - 1;
        else
            left = middle + 1;
    }
    return -1;
}
                  </code></pre>
                  <img class="img-responsive img-centered" src="/img/compiler_big1.png" alt="Parser and compiler for CBScript">
                  <pre style="text-align:left"><code>
// Ackermann Function
int ackermann(int m, int n) {
    if (m == 0) return n + 1;
    if (n == 0) return ackermann(m - 1, 1);

    return ackermann(m - 1, ackermann(m, n - 1));
}
                  </code></pre>
                  <img class="img-responsive img-centered" src="/img/compiler_big2.png" alt="Parser and compiler for CBScript">
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/Compiler" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/Compiler</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=Compiler" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal12" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Monte Carlo Localization Library</h2>
                  <p class="lead">A library for n-dimensional Monte Carlo localization.</p>
                  <img class="img-fluid d-block mx-auto" width="500px" src="/img/stages.jpg" alt="">
                  <p class="lead">Monte Carlo Localization (MCL) is useful in scenarios where uncertainty arises in a system over time (as a result of error; eg. physical instruments in the error-prone, real world) and when observations can be made to reduce said uncertainty. I've created a library for MCL in any number of dimensions, so that any number of error-prone factors can be accounted for.</p>
                  <p class="lead">The image above shows an example of the library in use in a simulated environment. Shown is a simulated instrument, initialized with no belief as to its initial position or orientation. Over time, and through observation, the instrument develops a correct belief as to its position and orientation using this MCL library.</p>
                  <p class="lead">This library is the result, in part, of a project funded by The MITRE Corporation and MIT's Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science through a MIT-MITRE Undergraduate Research and Innovation scholarship, and was developed primarily for use in <a href="/doc/Smart_Microscopy.pdf" target="blank">Self-Driving Microscopy: Bayesian Inference for Localization and Autonomous Navigation</a>.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
                    <b>View this project on GitHub: </b>
                    <a href="https://github.com/ewadkins/MCL" target="blank">https://github.com/ewadkins/MCL</a>
                    <iframe class="mt-2" src="http://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/card.html?user=ewadkins&repo=MCL" frameborder="0" scrolling="0" width="400" style="max-width: 70vw" height="180" allowtransparency="true"></iframe><br>
                  </div>
                  <a class="btn btn-dark btn-l" data-dismiss="modal" href="#">
                    <i class="fa fa-times"></i> Close Project</a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal13" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">

                  <!--<div class="lead mb-4">

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal14" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">
      <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">
            <div class="lr">
              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Financial Graph</h2>
                  <p class="lead">Graphs and analyzes your personal financial history.</p>

    <div class="portfolio-modal modal fade" id="portfolioModal15" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-hidden="true">

          <div class="close-modal" data-dismiss="modal">

              <div class="rl"></div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-lg-10 mx-auto">
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <h2>Web Scraper</h2>
                  <p class="lead">Various purpose scripts for easy web scraping.</p>
                  <p class="lead">Scripts used to efficiently scrape the web using various filters and heuristics to speed up the process. One example is my Wikipedia shortest path finder, which, given a starting page and goal page, will find the shortest path between the two using only links on Wikipedia.</p>
                  <p class="lead">More detailed project description coming soon!<br> In the meantime, check out some of my other projects.</p>
                  <div class="lead mb-4">
